headline: Why Broadcom Stock Was a Winner on Wednesday
summary: An analyst's recommendation upgrade put some lively zip in Broadcom's (NASDAQ: AVGO) stock price on Wednesday.  Well before market open on Hump Day, Daiwa Securities' Louis Miscioscia moved Broadcom up one notch, from outperform to buy.  According to reports, the analyst believes Broadcom is standing in front of no less than four elements that could drive its business higher: its custom artificial intelligence (AI) chips, networking, VMWare (an acquisition that closed in late 2023), and its foundational semiconductor products.

headline: Broadcom (AVGO) Upgraded by Japanese Firm
summary: Japanese investment bank Daiwa Securities raised its rating on Broadcom (AVGO) stock to Buy from Outperform today, Schwab Network reported. As reasons for the upgrade, the bank cited “four strong drivers” for the company, along with the stock’s valuation. Broadcom’s “Four Strong Drivers” AVGO is well-positioned to benefit from the strength of its application-specific integrated […]

headline: 2 Growth Stocks and 1 ETF to Buy Even If the Stock Market Keeps Falling in 2025
summary: At the time of this writing, the growth-heavy Nasdaq Composite is down by more than 10% year to date -- underperforming the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average -- both of which are also down, but by lesser degrees.  Daniel Foelber (Broadcom): Network connectivity and semiconductor giant Broadcom has given up all the gains it made after reporting its fiscal 2024 fourth-quarter results in December.
